intro: Ruschia gracilis, commonly known as the slender Ruschia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and its small, fleshy, blue-green leaves. It produces clusters of delicate, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and purple during the cooler months. Ruschia gracilis is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
